entry.title: Easy-Ruby
entry.summary: A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.
entry.content:
A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.

1. Constant & Variable

my_name = "å°æ˜" // Variable
MyName = "å°æ˜" // Constant

2. Control Flow

day = 5

if day==0
	puts "æ˜ŸæœŸæ—¥"
elsif day==6
	puts "æ˜ŸæœŸå…­"
else
	puts "å·¥ä½œæ—¥"
end

3. Data Type

  • Number
  • String
  • Range
  • Array
  • Hash
  • Symbol

ç±»å‹

puts 5.class  # => Integer

æ•°å­—

puts 10 + 3    # => 13
puts 10 - 3    # => 7
puts 10 * 3    # => 30
puts 10 / 3    # => 3
puts 10.0 / 3  # => 3.3333333333333335
puts 10 / 3.0  # => 3.3333333333333335
puts 10 % 3    # => 1

å­—ç¬¦ä¸²

name = "å°æ˜"
age = 18

puts "ä½ å¥½ï¼Œæˆ‘æ˜¯" + name + "ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»Šå¹´" + age.to_s + "å²" # => ä½ å¥½ï¼Œæˆ‘æ˜¯å°æ˜ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»Šå¹´18å²

puts "ä½ å¥½ï¼Œæˆ‘æ˜¯#{name}ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»Šå¹´#{age}å²" # => ä½ å¥½ï¼Œæˆ‘æ˜¯å°æ˜ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»Šå¹´18å²

èŒƒå›´

(1..5).to_a   # 1 åˆ° 5
(1...5).to_a  # 1 åˆ° 4

æ•°ç»„

thoughts = ["å„’å®¶", "é“å®¶", "å¢¨å®¶", "æ³•å®¶"]
p thoughts[1] # => é“å®¶
p thoughts[-1] # => æ³•å®¶
p thoughts.first # => å„’å®¶
p thoughts.last # => æ³•å®¶

å­—å…¸

thought_hash = {
	å„’å®¶: "å­”å­",
	é“å®¶: "è€å­",
	å¢¨å®¶: "å¢¨å­"
}

puts thought_hash.keys  # => []
puts thought_hash.values # => []

profile.each do |key, value|
  puts key
  puts value
end

ç¬¦å·

=begin
  Symbol æ˜¯ä¸å¯å˜çš„å¯¹è±¡
	Symbol æ˜¯å¸¦å˜é‡åçš„å¯¹è±¡
=end

:hello

3. Methods

def say_hello_to(name="ç¾å¥³")
	return "hello, #{name}"
end

p say_hello_to

4. Block

def say_hello
	puts "å¼€å§‹"
	yield 123        # æŠŠæ§åˆ¶æƒæš‚æ—¶è®©ç»™ Block
	puts "ç»“æŸ"
end

say_hello { |x|
	puts "è¿™é‡Œæ˜¯ Blockï¼Œæˆ‘æ”¶åˆ°äº†#{x}"
}

5. Class

class Cat
  attr_accessor :name #å±æ€§ 

  def initialize(name, gender)
    @name = name # å®ä¾‹å˜é‡
    @gender = gender
  end
    
  def say_hello
    puts "hello, my name is #{@name}" # => hello, my name is kitty
  end
end

6. Module

module Flyable
  def fly
    puts "I can fly!"
  end
end

class Cat
  include Flyable
end

kitty = Cat.new
kitty.fly        # => I can fly!

entry.title: Rails-Hello
entry.content:
return "Hello , World"

1 .Rails

$ gem install rails

2. New

$ rails new data_system -d mysql
$ cd data_system/
$ rails s

3. Database

mysql

4. Hello world

 $ rails g controller home index
 $ mkdir app/views/home
 $ touch app/views/home/index.html.erb

<!-- app/views/home/index.html.erb  -->

<h1>Hello, World!</h1>

http://localhost:3000

entry.title: Mac-MySQL
entry.content:
Relational database.

1. MySQL

$ brew install mysql

or

$ brew install mysql@5.6

2. Info

We've installed your MySQL database without a root password. To secure it run:
    mysql_secure_installation

MySQL is configured to only allow connections from localhost by default

To connect run:
    mysql -uroot

To have launchd start mysql now and restart at login:
  brew services start mysql
Or, if you don't want/need a background service you can just run:
  mysql.server start

entry.title: gitmoji
entry.summary: An emoji guide for your commit messages
entry.content:
An emoji guide for your commit messages

1. System

emoji alias messages
ğŸ :apple: Fixing something on macOS.
ğŸ§ :penguin: Fixing something on Linux.
ğŸ :checkered_flag: Fixing something on Windows.
ğŸ¤– :robot: Fixing something on Android.
ğŸ :green_apple: Fixing something on iOS.

2. Project

emoji alias messages
ğŸ‰ :tada: Initial commit.
âœ¨ :sparkles: Introducing new features.
ğŸ“ :pencil: Writing docs.
ğŸ› :bug: Fixing a bug.
ğŸš‘ :ambulance: Critical hotfix.
ğŸ”– :bookmark: Releasing / Version tags.
ğŸ”Š :loud_sound: Adding logs.
ğŸ”‡ :mute: Removing logs.
ğŸ‘¥ :busts_in_silhouette: Adding contributor(s).
ğŸ“¸ :camera_flash: Adding or updating snapshots

3. File

emoji alias messages
ğŸ”¥ :fire: Removing code or files.
ğŸ’„ :lipstick: Updating the UI and style files.
ğŸ”§ :wrench: Changing configuration files.
ğŸ“¦ :package: Updating compiled files or packages.
ğŸšš :truck: Moving or renaming files.
ğŸ—ƒ :card_file_box: Performing database related changes.
ğŸ™ˆ :see_no_evil: Adding or updating a .gitignore file
ğŸ’¬ :speech_balloon: Updating text and literals.

4. Code

emoji alias messages
ğŸ¨ :art: Improving structure / format of the code.
ğŸ”¥ :fire: Removing code or files.
ğŸ“ˆ :chart_with_upwards_trend: Adding analytics or tracking code.
â™»ï¸ :recycle: Refactoring code.
ğŸ’© :poop: Writing bad code that needs to be improved.
ğŸ‘½ :alien: Updating code due to external API changes.
ğŸ‘Œ :ok_hand: Updating code due to code review changes..
ğŸ’¡ :bulb: Documenting source code.
ğŸ» :beers: Writing code drunkenly.

5. Dependency

emoji alias messages
â¬‡ï¸ :arrow_down: Downgrading dependencies.
â¬†ï¸ :arrow_up: Upgrading dependencies.
ğŸ“Œ :pushpin: Pinning dependencies to specific versions.
â• :heavy_plus_sign: Adding a dependency.
â– :heavy_minus_sign: Removing a dependency.

6. Optimize

emoji alias messages
âš¡ï¸ :zap: Improving performance.
â™¿ï¸ :wheelchair: Improving accessibility.
ğŸ— :building_construction: Making architectural changes.
ğŸ“± :iphone: Working on responsive design.
ğŸ” :mag: Improving SEO
ğŸš¸ :children_crossing: Improving user experience / usability.

7. Deploy

emoji alias messages
ğŸš€ :rocket: Deploying stuff.
ğŸ’š :green_heart: Fixing CI Build.
ğŸ‘· :construction_worker: Adding CI build system.
ğŸ³ :whale: Work about Docker.
â˜¸ï¸ :wheel_of_dharma: Work about Kubernetes

8. Other

emoji alias messages
âœ… :white_check_mark: Updating tests.
ğŸ”’ :lock: Fixing security issues.
ğŸ—ƒ :card_file_box: Performing database related changes.
ğŸ¤¡ :clown_face: Mocking things.
ğŸ¥š :egg: Adding an easter egg.
âš— :alembic: Experimenting new things

2. KeyboardShortcuts

entry.title: Git
entry.summary: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.
entry.content:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

1. Install

$ brew install git
$ git --version

2. Configure

$ git config --global user.name "Your Actual Name"
$ git config --global user.email "Your Actual Email"
$ git config -l

3. Add & Commit

$ git add .
$ git commit -m "Commit message"

4. Push

$ git remote add origin <server>
$ git push origin master

5. Branch

$ git checkout -b feature_x
$ git checkout master
$ git branch -d feature_x
$ git push origin <branch>

6. Update & Merge

$ git pull
$ git merge <branch>

entry.title: Mac-Homebrew
entry.summary: The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)
entry.content:
The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

1. Install

/usr/bin/ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"

2. Usage

$ brew install wget
$ brew cask install firefox

$ brew uninstall wget
$ brew cask uninstall firefox

3. Search

$ brew search git

4. Info

$ brew info git

5. List

$ brew list

entry.title: NVM
entry.summary: Node Version Manager - POSIX-compliant bash script to manage multiple active node.js versions
entry.content:
Node Version Manager - POSIX-compliant bash script to manage multiple active node.js versions

1. Install

$ curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.34.0/install.sh | bash

$ nvm install node
$ node -v

2. List

$ nvm list
$ nvm list available

3. Use

$ nvm use 12.9.0

4. Uninstall

$ nvm uninstall

5. Removal

$ rm -rf "$NVM_DIR"
